#Text=The Utah Jazz took down the visiting Los Angeles Lakers at Vivint Smart Home Arena on Saturday , 96 - 81 .
#Text=Utah ( 3 - 3 ) evened its record after a tumultuous start to the new season .
#Text=On Saturday , the team failed to eclipse 100 points for the fifth time in six games , but made up for its low scoring totals with strong defensive play .
#Text=Holding Los Angeles to just 38 percent shooting and five made three - pointers , the Jazz was able to hold a comfortable lead for the majority of regulation .
#Text=Throughout the game , rookie Donovan Mitchell proved to be a tremendous bright spot for Utah .
#Text=Mitchell , who ranked last in the league in True Shooting Percentage before Saturday 's game , scored a highly efficient 22 points to lead the team .
#Text=The 13th overall pick in the 2017 draft came off the bench and played 27 minutes , leading the team in both scoring and shot attempts for the second time this season .
#Text=Utah has struggled to find a reliable first option early in the year , so Mitchell 's confidence and efficiency for a rookie was surely appreciated .
#Text=The Lakers ( 2 - 4 ) , meanwhile , saw far less impressive play from their highly - touted rookie guard .
#Text=Second overall pick Lonzo Ball once again struggled to find the basket on Saturday , shooting a woeful 3 - of - 9 from the field and posting five turnovers with just four assists .
#Text=The former UCLA stud delivered an impressive outing when LA faced Phoenix , but has shot under 25 percent from the field in his other five games .
#Text=It was a tough shooting night for the majority of the Lakers , as the team finished just 5 - of - 22 from beyond the arc .
#Text=While LA was able to outscore Utah 40 - 36 in the paint , struggles with perimeter play hampered the team 's offense all night .
#Text=In addition to Ball , shooting guard Kentavious Caldwell-Pope finished a dismal 2 - of - 11 from the field .
#Text=Los Angeles also would have liked to see better shooting from the free - throw line , where it went just 70 percent in total .
#Text=Utah will host the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday , while Los Angeles will host the Pistons on Thursday .
